intro: Cyphokentia billardierei, commonly known as the Sydney golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and public spaces across its native range.
